349.title: India concede late goal to lose 3-4 vs Spain at Women's Pro Hockey League
349.article_body: India lost 3-4 to Spain in their second leg of FIH Women's Pro Hockey League following the visitors' last minute winner at Kalinga Stadium, Bhubaneswar, on Sunday. It's India's first loss in tournament. India had earlier won first leg 2-1 on Saturday after being 0-1 down. Debutant Sangita Kumari (10'), Salima Tete (22') and Namita Toppo (49') scored for hosts.

350.title: UAE not taking sides in Russia-Ukraine conflict, says official
350.article_body: Speaking on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, a senior official from the United Arab Emirates (UAE) on Sunday said, "Our priority is to encourage all parties...to negotiate to find a political solution." The UAE believes that taking sides would only encourage violence, the official added. Notably, the UAE had abstained from voting on UN Security Council resolution condemning Russia's attack on Ukraine.

351.title: India equal world record for winning most consecutive T20I matches, whitewash SL 3-0
351.article_body: India defeated Sri Lanka by six wickets in the third T20I in Dharamshala to register their third straight 3-0 T20I series whitewash. With their 12th win on the trot, India also equalled Afghanistan and Romania's world record for winning most consecutive T20I matches. Afghanistan had won 12 straight T20Is in 2018-19, while Romania's sequence is ongoing.

352.title: PM Modi chairs high-level meeting on Ukraine-Russia conflict
352.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday chaired a high-level meeting to discuss the situation in Ukraine. PM Modi held the meeting after returning from Uttar Pradesh where he was campaigning for the state Assembly polls. A large number of Indians have been stranded in Ukraine following Russia's attack on the country.

353.title: 4 Army men summoned for tampering with U'khand postal ballots
353.article_body: The police in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh have summoned four Army personnel after former CM Harish Rawat shared a video allegedly showing them tampering with postal ballots in Jammu. "The...video is of four soldiers of the 2 Kumaon Regiments of the Army," SP Lokeshwar Singh said. "The police have sent a summon to all under Section 161 of the CrPC," he added.

354.title: Thousands battling life & death, campaigners busy in polls: Congress
354.article_body: While referring to the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict, Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said thousands of students are battling life and death, while campaigners are concerned with elections. "The hunger for power has made them insensitive. Why is the country helpless yet again?" he added. "Visuals of Indian students in bunkers are disturbing," said former Congress President Rahul Gandhi.

355.title: India's Nikhat, Nitu win gold medals at Strandja Boxing Tournament
355.article_body: Indian boxers Nikhat Zareen (52kg) and Nitu (48kg) won gold medals at 73rd Strandja Memorial Boxing Tournament in Bulgaria on Sunday. Nikhat beat Ukraine's Tetiana Kob 4-1, while Nitu defeated Italy's Erika Prisciandaro 5-0. The Indian contingent finished their campaign with three medals, including one bronze. Notably, it's Nikhat's second gold at the tournament after having won it in 2019.

356.title: Was waiting for Swami Prasad Maurya to join SP since 2011: Akhilesh
356.article_body: Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav, while addressing a gathering in UP's Fazilnagar on Sunday, said he was waiting for former UP minister Swami Prasad Maurya to join SP since 2011. He added, "Had [Maurya] joined us after leaving BSP, we wouldn't have seen bad days for five years." Maurya had switched from the BJP to SP in January this year.

357.title: 44 of 75 districts certified free of stray cattle, says UP govt
357.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has said 44 of the 75 districts in the state are certified "free of stray cattle". In a communique, the state government said 3% income received as cess will be spent on the welfare of destitute cattle at registered 'gaushalas'. PM Narendra Modi had recently promised a new policy to tackle stray cattle in Uttar Pradesh.

358.title: In a first, ITBP organises ice wall climbing competition in Ladakh
358.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) organised the first-ever ice wall climbing competition in Ladakh on Sunday. More than 100 climbers from 13 teams are taking part in the event. The opening ceremony of the ice wall climbing competition was held on Saturday and was attended by Ladakh Lieutenant Governor Radha Krishna Mathur.

359.title: Steps being taken to bring remaining students from Ukraine: K'taka CM
359.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said that steps are being taken to bring the remaining students of the state back home safely from Ukraine. "Helplines set up by the Union and State governments are in touch with the students and their parents," he said. The first batch of 12 Karnataka students stranded in Ukraine landed today in Bengaluru.

360.title: Was never a good actor, you keep learning throughout: Ankita Lokhande
360.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande said she was never a good actor, however, added that she kept learning while working in the television and film industry. "Television teaches you so much itself...when I did 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi' after 'Pavitra Rishta', I learned more things," she stated. Ankita added that the process of learning can never stop.

361.title: Mumbai reports zero deaths, 103 COVID-19 cases in last 24 hrs
361.article_body: Mumbai reported 103 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 10,56,399. Moreover, 165 recoveries were reported in Mumbai, with the city currently having 838 active cases. With no COVID-19 related death in the last 24 hours, the fatality count in the city stood at 16,691.

362.title: PM Modi won hearts with his development agenda: Maha Deputy CM
362.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar on Saturday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi won the hearts of people through his development agenda when he came to power. "People give an opportunity to those who talk of development," Pawar said at a press conference. "There are few people who are interested in controversies," he added.

363.title: SP candidate in UP booked for raping and beating up woman
363.article_body: Samajwadi Party candidate from Colonelganj Assembly constituency in UP, Yogesh Pratap Singh, was booked by police on Saturday for allegedly beating and raping a woman. According to police, Singh, his brothers and supporters barged into her house and assaulted her and her family members for allegedly supporting BJP. Police said they've provided security to the BJP candidate after the incident.

364.title: Hellish 20-hr journey, saw terrible things: Man who walked from Ukraine to Poland
364.article_body: A man named Manny Marotta walked from Ukraine's Lviv to Poland's Medyka and called his 20-hour journey "hellish". "I saw some terrible things...Ukrainian soldiers were...stopping vehicles...and yanking out any man aged 18-60 to conscript in Ukrainian Army," he tweeted. "A commissar was shouting, 'Say goodbye to your daughters, mothers & girlfriends; you must fight the Russian invader'," he added.

365.title: 'Dum Laga Ke Haisha' taught me to choose content first: Ayushmann
365.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said that his film 'Dum Laga Ke Haisha' taught him the "biggest lesson" of choosing content first in Bollywood. "The incredible reaction to 'Dum Laga Ke Haisha' showed me...my path in the industry was to pick the best scripts," he stated. The film, directed by Sharat Katariya, completed seven years of its release on Sunday.

366.title: 5,000 litre liquor seized in Ludhiana during Punjab polls: Police
366.article_body: The police in Ludhiana district recovered 5,000 litre liquor and ₹1.69 crore unaccounted money since the announcement of elections in Punjab, one-and-a-half months ago. The local unit of the Special Task Force has recovered 7.2 kg heroin from 10 persons in eight cases, the police said. Around 3.26 lakh litre lahan (raw material used for illicit liquor) was also destroyed.

367.title: Prashant Kishor visits Telangana amid rumours of being hired by TRS
367.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor visited the Kaleshwaram project in Telangana's Jayashankar Bhupalpally district on Sunday. This comes amid speculations that the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) may have hired Kishor ahead of the 2023 state Legislative Assembly polls. Kishore, who was accompanied by actor Prakash Raj, also visited other reservoirs such as the Mallanna Sagar reservoir.

368.title: Delhi reports 484 COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths in last 24 hrs
368.article_body: Delhi reported 484 new COVID-19 cases and three related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,59,634. Delhi currently has 2,086 active cases. All COVID-19 curbs in the city will be lifted from Monday following a drop in COVID-19 cases, the Delhi Disaster Management Authority announced on Friday.

369.title: 7-year-old boy falls into borewell in MP's Damoh, rescue ops on
369.article_body: A seven-year-old boy fell into a 300-feet deep borewell in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district on Sunday. The boy had gone to a farm when the incident occurred. The borewell is said to be seven inches in diameter. "The rescue team has reached...and every effort is being made to get the child out safely," said SDM Abhishek Thakur.

370.title: Future Retail suspends store operations amid Reliance takeover: Report
370.article_body: India's second-largest retailer Future Retail has suspended most of its online and offline operations amid reports of Reliance Industries taking over its stores including Big Bazaar, reported Reuters. "We regret to inform you that currently stores are non-operational for 2 days," Big Bazaar told social media users on Sunday. Its app and website were also not available for online ordering.

371.title: Fantastic initiative: Hussey on CSK opening cricket academies in Tamil Nadu
371.article_body: CSK batting coach Michael Hussey said the franchise's decision to establish Super Kings Academy, for both girls and boys, is a "fantastic initiative". He added that it'll give opportunities to many youngsters in accessing great facilities and great coaching, and one day help them play for CSK in the IPL. CSK will initially establish the academies in Chennai and Salem.

372.title: Ukrainian man tries to stop Russian tank with his bare hands, video viral
372.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian man attempting to stop a Russian tank with his bare hands has surfaced on social media. In the video, the man first climbed on the tank, then jumped on the ground to push the tank with his hands. Later, he knelt in front of the tank in an attempt to stop it from going forward.

373.title: Germany to hike defence budget: Chancellor after invasion of Ukraine
373.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Sunday said that Germany would increase its spending on defence to over 2% of its GDP in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We'll have to invest more in...security...to protect our freedom and democracy," he added. The government has decided to supply 100 billion euros for military investments from its 2022 budget, he further said.

374.title: Leeds sack manager Bielsa with team 2 points away from PL relegation zone
374.article_body: Leeds United sacked their manager Marcelo Bielsa on Sunday after the team's 0-4 loss against Tottenham. With this defeat, the team has dropped to within two points of Premier League relegation zone. Leeds has conceded 20 goals in five games in February, a Premier League record for goals allowed in a single month. Bielsa had joined Leeds in 2018.

375.title: Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli arrested for drunk driving; released on bail
375.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli was arrested on Sunday for allegedly driving under the influence of alcohol and hitting a passing car at a Bandra society in Mumbai. It was alleged that he argued with the complex's watchman and some residents after the incident. He was investigated at the Bandra Police Station and was released on bail later.

376.title: 1 lakh protest in Germany against Russia's invasion of Ukraine
376.article_body: Around 1 lakh people took part in a protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine in Germany's Berlin on Sunday. Some of the protesters carried placards with slogans such as "Hands off Ukraine", "No World War 3" and "Stop the killer". "It's important to me for Germany to show that it's standing for democracy in Europe," one of the protesters said.

377.title: FPIs withdraw net ₹35,506 cr in Feb 2022, highest since March 2020
377.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹35,506 crore in the month of February 2022, the highest amount withdrawn by FPIs since March 2020 at ₹1,18,203 crore. FPIs have been net sellers since October 2021. During February 1-25, FPIs pulled out ₹31,158 crore from equities and ₹4,467 crore from the debt segment, according to depositories’ data.

378.title: Rohit Sharma breaks world record for playing most men's T20Is
378.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has broken the world record for playing most men's T20I matches. India's third T20I against Sri Lanka is Rohit's 125th match in T20I cricket. Rohit overtook veteran Pakistani all-rounder Shoaib Malik, who has played 124 T20I matches. Notably, Rohit is the only Indian to have played 100 or more T20Is for India so far.

379.title: WHO warns of 'dangerously low' medical oxygen supplies in Ukraine
379.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Sunday warned of "dangerously low" medical oxygen supplies in Ukraine due to the Ukraine-Russia crisis. "Trucks are unable to transport oxygen supplies from plants to hospitals across the country, including capital Kyiv," the WHO said. "The majority of hospitals could exhaust their oxygen reserves within 24 hours. Some have already run out," it warned.

380.title: Amazon sued for $100 mn by US man who lost his leg in crash with delivery van
380.article_body: A man is suing Amazon for $100 million in the US after a collision with a delivery van resulted in the amputation of his left leg. Justin Hartley claimed the accident caused him "severe bodily injuries", including a fractured left wrist. He alleged that Amazon is responsible because it puts pressure on employees, causing them to become distracted while driving.

381.title: Compensation for death in hit & run cases raised from ₹25k to ₹2 lakh: Govt
381.article_body: The Centre has increased the compensation for hit and run accident victims with effect from April 1. The compensation has been increased from ₹12,500 to ₹50,000 for grievous hurt and from ₹25,000 to ₹2,00,000 in case of death. The new scheme will be applicable for all roads and highways across India, the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways said.

382.title: Rick Harrison sued by mother over family assets, ownership: Report
382.article_body: Rick Harrison of reality show 'Pawn Stars' fame has been sued by his mother in a dispute over family assets and business ownership in Las Vegas. "The lawsuit was filed...in Nevada state court by attorneys for Harrison's mother, Joanne Harrison," a report said. "The allegations are false and I think...my 81-year-old mother is being manipulated," Rick said.

383.title: Woman & man tied to tree, beaten by husband in Madhya Pradesh
383.article_body: A man and a married woman were allegedly tied to a tree and beaten by her husband and other relatives after they were seen together in MP's Rajgarh district, police said on Sunday. The incident took place in Khanauta village on Saturday, where victims were held captive, police added. A case has been registered against woman's husband and another person.

384.title: Rajkummar, Taapsee don't do independent films: Vivek Agnihotri
384.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has said in an interview that Rajkummar Rao and Taapsee Pannu don't do independent films. "When they make a film and say it's an independent one, it's not! It's supported and financed by big studios," Vivek said. "They are doing the same thing and...naming it differently. I am the only genuine independent filmmaker...in India," he added.

385.title: BJP demands Bengal civic polls be declared null & void over violence
385.article_body: BJP's West Bengal unit on Sunday wrote to the State Election Commissioner demanding the municipal polls "to be declared null and void". "West Bengal witnessed unprecedented violence, attacks, arson and complete failure of the law and order machinery," the letter read. BJP accused "workers of the ruling...Trinamool Congress" and the state's "police and administration" of orchestrating the violence.

386.title: There'd be shock: Reeves on whether Superman appears in Batman sequels
386.article_body: 'The Batman' director Matt Reeves said there would be "a lot of shock" if Superman appears in the sequels. "I mean, people would have to say, oh my God," he stated. However, he added, "That is not the intention at this point, to figure out how to make that come." Actor Henry Cavill plays the Superman in the DC universe.

387.title: 7 people killed in 'rain bomb' floods in Australia
387.article_body: Flash floods caused by heavy rains have left at least seven people dead in Australia's Queensland and New South Wales (NSW) states. "We never expected this rain...This rain bomb is just really, you know, it's unrelenting...It's just coming down in buckets," Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk said. More than 28,000 homes were left without power in Queensland.

388.title: Ukraine agrees to hold talks with Russia on Ukraine-Belarus border
388.article_body: The Ukrainian delegation has agreed to meet the Russian delegation with no preconditions on the Ukraine-Belarus border in the vicinity of the Pripyat river, Ukraine's Defence Ministry said. Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko has taken responsibility for ensuring that all planes, helicopters and missiles stationed on Belarusian territory remain on the ground during the travel, talks and return.

389.title: Black belt Putin suspended as Honorary President of Int'l Judo Federation
389.article_body: The International Judo Federation on Sunday suspended Russian President Vladimir Putin's status as Honorary President and Ambassador of the International Judo Federation, citing the ongoing war in Ukraine. Russia's invasion by land, air and sea in Ukraine on Thursday followed a declaration of war by Putin. A judo black belt, the 69-year-old is a keen practitioner of the discipline.

390.title: Pak's Ashraf ruled out of Test series vs Aus with groin injury: Reports
390.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Faheem Ashraf has been reportedly ruled out of upcoming three-match Test series against Australia due to a groin injury. Earlier, spinner Mohammad Nawaz was ruled out due to an injury. Notably, it is Australia's first tour in Pakistan since 1998. First Test will begin on March 4 in Rawalpindi. Australia have reached Pakistan for the historic series.

391.title: Apple's 'brilliant' CEO regards Apple users as first love: Warren Buffett
391.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway's Chairman Warren Buffett in his annual letter to shareholders said, "Tim Cook, Apple's brilliant CEO...regards users of Apple products as his first love." Listing Apple under "Our Four Giants", Buffett said Berkshire holds a 5.55% stake in Apple. The 91-year-old investor also credited the growth of Berkshire's insurance unit to his hiring of Ajit Jain in 1986.

392.title: Putin orders nuclear deterrent forces on high alert amid tensions with West
392.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has put Russia's nuclear deterrent forces on high alert in response to what he called "aggressive statements" by leading NATO powers over the situation in Ukraine. He further ordered his top officials to put them in a "special regime of combat duty." This would mean the nuclear weapons will be prepared for increased readiness to launch.

393.title: Sweden, Finland & Denmark shut their airspace to Russian planes
393.article_body: Sweden, Finland and Denmark said they will shut their airspace to Russian planes on Sunday following the Russian invasion of Ukraine. The Nordic countries join other European nations, including UK, Romania, Germany and Poland, which have also closed their airspace. "It is now absolutely necessary to proceed with further...measures to isolate Russia," Swedish EU Minister Hans Dahlgren said.

394.title: Mumbai vendor kills 22-yr-old man for threatening to harm his wife
394.article_body: A vegetable vendor from Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly killing a 22-year-old man who had reportedly threatened to harm his wife. According to the case details, the accused, Sundar Naidu, had gathered some of his friends and attacked the victim near a railway track on Thursday. The victim's grandmother reported the incident to the police after finding his body.

395.title: Ashton Kutcher supports wife Mila Kunis' home nation Ukraine
395.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, Hollywood actor Ashton Kutcher took to Twitter and wrote, "I stand with Ukraine." Ukraine is Ashton's wife and actress Mila Kunis' native country. In a 2008 interview with Los Angeles Times, Mila had stated that her parents left the country and immigrated to the United States "right at the fall [of the Soviet Union]."

396.title: 2 PCMC swimming pools in Pune shut shortly after reopening
396.article_body: Two Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation-run swimming pools at Kasarwadi and Sangvi remained closed on Sunday citing repair works, while one at Pimple Gurav denied entry to swimmers and children. This comes after PCMC pools reopened earlier this month following a two-year gap due to pandemic. PCMC's additional municipal commissioner said meeting will be convened to find out the state of pools.

397.title: K'taka Congress resumes Mekedatu rally, leaders move towards B'luru
397.article_body: Karnataka Congress resumed the Mekedatu march on Sunday as it was halted in January due to a surge in COVID-19 cases. The rally will end at National College Grounds in Bengaluru. The party leaders will cover a distance of 50 km in five days. The rally aims to implement the Mekedatu project to regulate water flow to neighbouring Tamil Nadu.

398.title: Pink booth opened for women at Delhi University's Mata Sundri College
398.article_body: President of the Police Family Welfare Society, Anu Asthana, inaugurated a pink booth at Delhi University's Mata Sundri College for Women on Saturday. She virtually inaugurated seven more pink booths and cited it as a novel initiative for the grievance redressal of women. On Friday, the police organised a programme to increase the visibility of women police on the streets.

399.title: Pune records decade's third warmest February in 2022
399.article_body: February 2022 has been the third warmest February in Pune in the last decade with the highest maximum temperature touching 35.7°C, according to the India Meteorological Department. The highest maximum temperature in the last decade was reported in 2017 at 37.5°C. The all-time record according to IMD has been from 1953 when the mercury touched 38.9°C.

400.title: No proposal to remove face mask rule yet: Maharashtra Health Minister
400.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said there is no proposal to remove face mask rule yet despite waning COVID-19 cases. "Chief Minister (Uddhav Thackeray) [has said] that we cannot assume that...pandemic is over. So...decision on mask liberty will be taken after careful consideration," Tope said. The third wave has almost ended but we should continue being vigilant, he added.

401.title: Problem is not that Putin is smart, real problem is our leaders are so dumb: Trump
401.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump said, "Reporters asked me if I thought Russian President Vladimir Putin was smart. I said, 'of course, he's smart'." Trump added, "The problem is not that Putin is smart, which of course he's smart, but the real problem is that our leaders are dumb." Trump said he likes to tell the "truth".
